org.sbrubbles.conditio

Class Scope

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sbrubbles.conditio.Scope
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public final class Scope
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable
    The resource responsible for managing the signalling machinery and the available handlers and restarts.

    Its instantiation is handled by create(), which, along with Java's try-with-resources, is used to create nested scopes and leave them when appropriate. This class creates and manages a stack of nested Scopes, and provides ways to search for handlers and restarts throughout this stack.

    As a consequence, calling Scope.create() without closeing it properly will break the nesting. Use it only in a try-with-resources, and you'll be fine :)

    The main operations are:
    • signal(Condition): signals that something happened, and (eventually) returns the result;
    • handle(Class, BiFunction): establishes a handler, which deals with conditions by either directly providing an end result for signal or choosing a restart to do so;
    • on(Class, Function): establishes a restart, which can provide a result; and
    • restart(Restart.Option): finds and runs a restart compatible with the given option.

    Usage in practice should look something like this: 

       try(Scope scope = Scope.create()) {
     // establishing a new handler, which delegates the work to a RetryWith-compatible restart
     scope.handle(MalformedEntry.class, (c, s) -> s.restart(new RetryWith("FAIL: " + c.getText())));

     // ...somewhere deeper in the call stack...
     try(Scope scope = Scope.create()) {
       // establishing a new restart
       scope.on(RetryWith.class, r -> func(r.getValue()));

       // ...somewhere deeper still...
       try(Scope scope = Scope.create()) {
         // signals a condition, and waits for the result
         Entry entry = (Entry) scope.signal(new MalformedEntry("NOOOOOOOO"));

         // carry on...
       }
     }
   }
    See Also:
    Condition, Handler, Restart

      Updates the current scope when execution leaves the try block.

      Creates and returns a new instance, nested in the (now former) current scope.

    • Method Detail

      • on

        public <T extends Restart.Option,S extends T> Scope on(Class<S> optionType,
                                                       Function<T,?> body)
        Establishes a new restart in this scope.
        Parameters:
        optionType - the type of restart options accepted.
        body - the code which will take an instance of optionType and generate a result for signal(Condition).
        Returns:
        this instance, for method chaining.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if one or both parameters are null.

      • handle

        public <T extends Condition,S extends T> Scope handle(Class<S> conditionType,
                                                      BiFunction<T,Scope,?> body)
        Establishes a new handler in this scope.
        Parameters:
        conditionType - the type of conditions handled.
        body - the handler code, which takes as arguments a condition and the scope where signal() was called, and returns a result.
        Returns:
        this instance, for method chaining.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if one or both parameters are null.
        See Also:
        signal(Condition)

      • signal

        public Object signal(Condition condition)
              throws HandlerNotFoundException,
                     RestartNotFoundException
        Signals a situation which the currently running code doesn't know how to handle. This method will search for a compatible handler and run it, returning the result.
        Parameters:
        condition - a condition, representing a situation which higher-level code will decide how to handle.
        Returns:
        the end result, as provided by the selected handler.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if no condition was given.
        HandlerNotFoundException - if no available handler was able to handle this condition.
        RestartNotFoundException

      • restart

        public Object restart(Restart.Option restartOption)
               throws RestartNotFoundException
        Searches for a restart compatible with the given option, starting from this scope, and runs it.
        Parameters:
        restartOption - identifies which restart to run, and holds any data required for that restart's operation.
        Returns:
        the result of the found restart's execution.
        Throws:
        RestartNotFoundException - if no restart compatible with restartOption could be found.

      • getAllHandlers

        public Iterable<Handler> getAllHandlers()
        An object to iterate over all active handlers in the call stack, starting from this instance to the root scope.
        Returns:
        an iterable to get all active handlers in the call stack.

      • getAllRestarts

        public Iterable<Restart> getAllRestarts()
        An object to iterate over all active restarts in the call stack, starting from this instance to the root scope.
        Returns:
        an iterable to get all active restarts in the call stack.

      • getParent

        public Scope getParent()
        The Scope instance wrapping this one. May be null if this is the topmost Scope.
        Returns:
        the Scope instance wrapping this one, or null if this is a root scope.

      • isRoot

        public boolean isRoot()
        If this is the topmost scope in its execution.
        Returns:
        true if this is the topmost scope.
